title: Proof of concept: the PCKF, converted
content:
Whilst on a random journey around the net, I stumbled across the ezBoard converter for phpBB again. Having nothing better to do, I decided to try it out on the PCKF. (I'd done this shortly before the ezBoard attack, and to my shame deleted the converted database assuming I'd never need it.) The link below is the result of my brief effort to convert this forum into a phpBB forum.

This isn't a live forum, so you can't register or log in - it's just there so you can look at it as a demonstration of how simple the move would be.

[url=http://toxicsheep.nfshost.com/pckf/]PCKF Mirror[/url][url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: Proof of concept: the PCKF, converted
content:
Access denied for every subforum. It's nice how easy the move can be though.

EDIT: actually, for every link. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]
EDIT 2: great, works now. Nice conversion! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

content: Looks good.  Definitely got to look into this, as that Yuku thing looms on the horizon.

title: Oooooh, yeah.

And grafix. Great work there. I do recall that theme you were working on, many moons ago. I'm happy with the current theme, but if someone comes up with a better one I'm all for it. Let's just get the hell away from ezBored already!

title: Re: Oooooh, yeah.
content:
Well, if there's one person on this forum who is respected enough to make a decision like that, I think it'd have to be KR... If he left ezBoard to start his own Keen forum, I'd certainly join him.

Ask yourself this - if Chogall or one of the other PCKF owners came along and gave you one URL for the new board, and KR gave you a different one, which one would you choose? (and don't say you'd visit both, that's not the point.) Not that I have anything against Chogall, but KR certainly posts a lot more and I think his forum would be much more active.

title: Re: Oooooh, yeah.
content:
Speaking of this forum, yours truly accidentally removed something small part of html code from the header you can see on main page. I removed the line about the results of the level competition (as it's a 'few' weeks old now) and accidentally removed something else that results the header not to be centered anymore. Does anyone know how it was? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-embarrassed.gif[/img] Naturally I could try and center it with pure html center command.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Oooooh, yeah.
content: Enclosing the header like so:[pre] <div style="text-align:center;"><!--EZCODE ITALIC START--><em>header goes here</em><!--EZCODE ITALIC END--></div>[/pre]should work.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: Oooooh, yeah.
content:
Aha. Well, I just before reading this changed the p have 'center' as its align. I guess the original could've been something like that, as I had accidentally removed the p-part. Now it looks as it was before. Your way is probably the best, but I let it be as it (hopefully) was before. This place generally isn't designed in CSS, either. (I guess.) Cheers. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Oooooh, yeah.
content:
Are you kidding me? I would listen to any of the more active, older peoples. Spleen, Mr.Rush, Xtra and perhaps even Grafix.

Oh don't get me wrong, I wouldn't ignore any of the 'respectable' people around here, it's just that in my mind KR is the central Keener here. He's been around for a long time and his posts generally seem to be more Keen-related than everyone else's. If Spleen, Xtra and Grafix got together and created a new forum instead of this one I'd definitely make the switch, but KR's probably the only person here who could successfully go it alone, without any backing from other members.
